comments.body: Please, could you write an explanation why do you need this patch?
Sure, should I add it as a comment in `meta.yaml`? (the explanation is that gpaw's config.py assumes libpython is a dynamic library, whereas on conda-forge it seems to be a static library).
I've opened a merge request upstream: https://gitlab.com/gpaw/gpaw/merge_requests/525

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@  sha256: {{ sha256 }}
  patches:
    - 001_config-py.patch
    # patch 001 is needed because gpaw's config.py assumes that libpython is a dynamic library,
    # whereas the python version used by conda-forge provides a static library. Hopefully gpaw-devs

comments.body: Why do you need this build string?

I'm basically duplicating the recipe for LAMMPS which is also built with and without MPI:
https://github.com/conda-forge/lammps-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/meta.yaml
I just thought it was needed for the conda packages to have different names depending on MPI imlementation...
